_**The Divergent Series**_ is a feature film trilogy based on the
_[Divergent](/wiki/Divergent_trilogy "Divergent trilogy")_ novels by the
American author [Veronica Roth](/wiki/Veronica_Roth "Veronica Roth").
Distributed by [Summit Entertainment](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment "Summit
Entertainment") and [Lionsgate Films](/wiki/Lionsgate_Films "Lionsgate
Films"), the series consists of three [science
fiction](/wiki/Science_fiction_film "Science fiction film") films set in a
[dystopian](/wiki/Dystopian "Dystopian") society. They have been produced by
[Lucy Fisher](/wiki/Lucy_Fisher "Lucy Fisher"), Pouya Shabazian, and [Douglas
Wick](/wiki/Douglas_Wick "Douglas Wick").

The series star [Shailene Woodley](/wiki/Shailene_Woodley "Shailene Woodley")
and [Theo James](/wiki/Theo_James "Theo James") as lead characters [Beatrice
Prior](/wiki/Beatrice_Prior "Beatrice Prior") (Tris) and [Tobias
Eaton](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Tobias_.22Four.22_Eaton
"List of The Divergent trilogy characters") (Four), respectively. The
supporting cast includes [Ansel Elgort](/wiki/Ansel_Elgort "Ansel Elgort"),
[Zoë Kravitz](/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz "Zoë Kravitz"), and [Miles
Teller](/wiki/Miles_Teller "Miles Teller"). [Kate Winslet](/wiki/Kate_Winslet
"Kate Winslet") played the main antagonist in the first two films. The first
film in the series was directed by [Neil Burger](/wiki/Neil_Burger "Neil
Burger"), while the second and third films were directed by [Robert
Schwentke](/wiki/Robert_Schwentke "Robert Schwentke").

The Veronica Roth novels consist primarily of the trilogy ('Divergent',
'Insurgent', 'Allegiant'). Development began in 2011 following
[Summit's](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment "Summit Entertainment") acquisition of
the film rights to the [_Divergent_ novel](/wiki/Divergent_\(novel\)
"Divergent \(novel\)") in partnership with production company [Red Wagon
Entertainment](/wiki/Red_Wagon_Entertainment "Red Wagon Entertainment").[1]
The studios announced production on the sequel following the first film's
strong performance in Thursday late-night screenings, where it grossed $4.9
million.[2] They acquired film rights to the [_Allegiant_
novel](/wiki/Allegiant_\(novel\) "Allegiant \(novel\)") in December 2013,
deciding in April 2014 to split the third novel into a two-part film
adaptation.[3]

The first installment, _[Divergent](/wiki/Divergent_\(film\) "Divergent
\(film\)")_ (2014), grossed over $288 million worldwide,[4] while the second
installment, _[The Divergent Series:
Insurgent](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Insurgent "The Divergent Series:
Insurgent")_ (2015), grossed over $297 million worldwide.[5] _Insurgent_ was
also the first _Divergent_ film to be released in [IMAX 3D](/wiki/IMAX_3D
"IMAX 3D").[6] The third installment, _[The Divergent Series:
Allegiant](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Allegiant "The Divergent Series:
Allegiant")_ (2016), grossed $179 million. Thus, the first three films of the
series have grossed over $765 million worldwide. A fourth film, [The Divergent
Series: Ascendant](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Ascendant "The Divergent
Series: Ascendant") was to be released theatrically, but due to _Allegiant 's_
poor showing at the box office, it was announced it will be released as a TV
movie.

##
Development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Development")]

In March 2011, [Summit Entertainment](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment "Summit
Entertainment") picked up the rights for
_[Divergent](/wiki/Divergent_\(novel\) "Divergent \(novel\)")_ with [Douglas
Wick](/wiki/Douglas_Wick "Douglas Wick") and Lucy Fisher's production company
Red Wagon Entertainment, while [Lionsgate](/wiki/Lionsgate_Films "Lionsgate
Films") distributes the franchise.[1] [Neil Burger](/wiki/Neil_Burger "Neil
Burger") was announced as the director on August 23, 2012.[7] [Evan
Daugherty](/wiki/Evan_Daugherty "Evan Daugherty"), who co-wrote the screenplay
with [Vanessa Taylor](/wiki/Vanessa_Taylor "Vanessa Taylor"), said, "I get
hung up on the toughness of the movie but of equal importance is the love
story between Tris and Four. It's inherently and inextricably linked to Tris'
character journey. There will be plenty of sexual tension and chemistry, but
it's important that all of that stuff doesn't just feel like it's thrown in,
but that it all helps Tris grow as a character."[8] Daugherty further added,
"It's tricky because the book is a very packed read with a lot of big ideas.
So, distilling that into a cool, faithful two-hour movie is challenging. Not
only do you have to establish five factions, but you have to acknowledge that
there's a sixth entity, which is the divergent, and you also have the
factionless. So there's a world that really has to be built out for the big
screen… the movie is going to do it a little more efficiently."[9] Author
[Veronica Roth](/wiki/Veronica_Roth "Veronica Roth") said about the script of
the film: "Reading a script is a really interesting experience. I'd never read
a script before. I was really impressed by how closely it stuck to the general
plot line of the book."[10]

Initially, the budget of the film was $40 million but later
[Lionsgate](/wiki/Lionsgate "Lionsgate") increased it to $80 million (which
finally changed to $85 million) due to the success of _[The Hunger
Games](/wiki/The_Hunger_Games_\(film_series\) "The Hunger Games \(film
series\)")_. Analyst Ben Mogil said, "_Divergent_ is more similar to _Hunger
Games_ in that the company owns the underlying economics (i.e. production) and
the budget (at $80[million]) is more manageable."[11]

In December 2013, [Summit Entertainment](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment "Summit
Entertainment") announced that a film adaptation of
_[Insurgent](/wiki/Insurgent_\(novel\) "Insurgent \(novel\)")_ , the second
novel in the _Divergent_ trilogy, would be released as _The Divergent Series:
Insurgent_ on March 20, 2015,[12] as a sequel to the film adaptation of
_[Divergent](/wiki/Divergent_\(novel\) "Divergent \(novel\)")_ with Brian
Duffield originally chosen to write the script for the film.[13][14] On
December 16, 2013, it was announced that [Neil Burger](/wiki/Neil_Burger "Neil
Burger"), director of _Divergent_ , would not return to direct _Insurgent_ as
he was still working on the first film.[15] On February 13, 2014, it was
announced that [Robert Schwentke](/wiki/Robert_Schwentke "Robert Schwentke")
was offered the director position for the film and that [Akiva
Goldsman](/wiki/Akiva_Goldsman "Akiva Goldsman") had been hired to re-write
Duffield's script.[16][17]

Also in December 2013, [Summit Entertainment](/wiki/Summit_Entertainment
"Summit Entertainment") announced that the film adaptation of
_[Allegiant](/wiki/Allegiant_\(novel\) "Allegiant \(novel\)")_ , the third and
final novel in the _Divergent_ trilogy, would be released in March 2016,
serving as the finale of the series, which at the time was planned as a
trilogy,[12] but on April 11, 2014, the studio decided to split the novel into
a two-part film, much the like the _[Harry
Potter](/wiki/Harry_Potter_\(film_series\) "Harry Potter \(film series\)")_ ,
_[Twilight](/wiki/The_Twilight_Saga_\(film_series\) "The Twilight Saga \(film
series\)")_ , and _[Hunger Games](/wiki/The_Hunger_Games_\(film_series\) "The
Hunger Games \(film series\)")_ franchises did with the finales of their
series. [Lionsgate Motion Picture Group](/wiki/Lionsgate_Motion_Picture_Group
"Lionsgate Motion Picture Group") co-chairmen [Rob
Friedman](/wiki/Rob_Friedman "Rob Friedman") and Patrick Wachsberger said in a
statement that, "Veronica Roth brings her captivating story to a masterful
conclusion in 'Allegiant,' a rich, action-packed book with material that is
ideally suited to two strong and fulfilling movies. The storytelling arc and
world of the characters lend themselves perfectly to two films, a storytelling
strategy that has worked very well for us on the two _Twilight Breaking Dawn_
films and about which we're tremendously enthusiastic for the two upcoming
_Mockingjay_ films of _The Hunger Games_ franchise".[18] [Noah
Oppenheim](/wiki/Noah_Oppenheim "Noah Oppenheim") was announced as the
screenwriter for the first part of the _Allegiant_ adaptation on July 9,
2014.[19] On December 5, 2014, it was announced that Robert Schwentke will
return to direct _Part 1_.[20] On September 10, 2015, it was announced that
the two films would be re-titled, with _Part 1_ being renamed as _The
Divergent Series: Allegiant_ and _Part 2_ as _The Divergent Series:
Ascendant_.[21]

### Casting the main
roles[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Casting the main roles")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Shailene_Woodley_March_18%2C_2014_%28cropped%29.jpg/142px-
Shailene_Woodley_March_18%2C_2014_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Shailene_Woodley_March_18,_2014_\(cropped\).jpg)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/Theo_James_March_18%2C_2014_%28cropped%29.jpg/163px-
Theo_James_March_18%2C_2014_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Theo_James_March_18,_2014_\(cropped\).jpg)

[Shailene Woodley](/wiki/Shailene_Woodley "Shailene Woodley") (left) and [Theo
James](/wiki/Theo_James "Theo James") (right) at the _Divergent_ LA Premiere
on March 18, 2014.

On October 22, 2012, it was announced that [Shailene
Woodley](/wiki/Shailene_Woodley "Shailene Woodley") had landed the lead role
of Beatrice "Tris" Prior.[22] [Lucas Till](/wiki/Lucas_Till "Lucas Till"),
[Jack Reynor](/wiki/Jack_Reynor "Jack Reynor"), [Jeremy
Irvine](/wiki/Jeremy_Irvine "Jeremy Irvine"), [Alex
Pettyfer](/wiki/Alex_Pettyfer "Alex Pettyfer"), [Brenton
Thwaites](/wiki/Brenton_Thwaites "Brenton Thwaites"), [Alexander
Ludwig](/wiki/Alexander_Ludwig "Alexander Ludwig") and [Luke
Bracey](/wiki/Luke_Bracey "Luke Bracey") were all considered for the role of
Tobias "Four" Eaton.[23][24] On March 15, 2013, it was announced that [Theo
James](/wiki/Theo_James "Theo James") had been cast as Four.[25]

Though James was 10 years older than the character when cast, Roth praised his
casting "I was sure within seconds: this was 'Four', no question. Theo is able
to capture 'Four's' authority and strength, as well as his depth and
sensitivity." She also mentions the chemistry between him and Shailene: "He is
a perfect match for Shailene's incredibly strong presence as Tris. I'm
thrilled!"[26] The producers said about his casting: "We took our time to find
the right actor to fill the role of Four, and Theo is definitely the perfect
fit. Veronica has crafted a truly iconic character in Four and we cannot wait
to begin production and bring him and this story to life for millions of fans
around the world."[25]

"Edit section: Production")]

###
Directors[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Directors")]

[Neil Burger](/wiki/Neil_Burger "Neil Burger") directed the first film,
_Divergent_ , and was originally going to direct the sequel, _The Divergent
Series: Insurgent_ , but in December 2013 it was announced that Burger would
not return, due to him still working on post-production work for the first
film. Speaking on the subject the director stated, "There was no breathing
room. They were like, 'We're holding to a March 2015 release date, and we have
to start no later than May 2014.' It was a recipe for failure, at least with
me on board. I wouldn't be able to do either thing right. I reluctantly let it
go".[27] In February 2014, it was confirmed that [Robert
Schwentke](/wiki/Robert_Schwentke "Robert Schwentke") would direct the sequel
instead.[16] On December 5, 2014, it was announced that Schwentke would return
for _The Divergent Series: Allegiant_.[28]

###
Scripts[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Scripts")]

_[Snow White and the Huntsman](/wiki/Snow_White_and_the_Huntsman "Snow White
and the Huntsman")_ screenwriter [Evan Daugherty](/wiki/Evan_Daugherty "Evan
Daugherty") and _[Hope Springs](/wiki/Hope_Springs_\(2012_film\) "Hope Springs
\(2012 film\)")_ screenwriter [Vanessa Taylor](/wiki/Vanessa_Taylor "Vanessa
Taylor") co-wrote the screenplay for _Divergent_. During the time that Neil
Burger was originally going to direct the sequel, Brian Duffield was recruited
to write the screenplay for _The Divergent Series: Insurgent_ , but after
Burger dropped out of the film and Robert Schwentke took over as director, he
brought in [Akiva Goldsman](/wiki/Akiva_Goldsman "Akiva Goldsman") and [Mark
Bomback](/wiki/Mark_Bomback "Mark Bomback") to rewrite Duffield's script.

The screenplay for the two-part finale, _The Divergent Series: Allegiant_ and
_Ascendant_ , was written by [Noah Oppenheim](/wiki/Noah_Oppenheim "Noah
Oppenheim"), Adam Cooper, Bill Collage, and [Stephen
Chbosky](/wiki/Stephen_Chbosky "Stephen Chbosky").

### Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Cast")]

On March 11, 2013, it was announced that the roles of Tori, Christina, and
Caleb had gone to [Maggie Q](/wiki/Maggie_Q "Maggie Q"), [Zoë
Kravitz](/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz "Zoë Kravitz"), and [Ansel
Elgort](/wiki/Ansel_Elgort "Ansel Elgort"), respectively.[29] [Ray
Stevenson](/wiki/Ray_Stevenson_\(actor\) "Ray Stevenson \(actor\)"), [Jai
Courtney](/wiki/Jai_Courtney "Jai Courtney") and [Aaron
Eckhart](/wiki/Aaron_Eckhart "Aaron Eckhart") were announced to be in talks to
join the cast on March 15, 2013,[30] Stevenson and Courtney joined the cast as
Marcus Eaton and Eric, respectively.[31] That same day, [Miles
Teller](/wiki/Miles_Teller "Miles Teller") was cast as Peter.[32] The studio’s
announcement included a bit of casting news: Mekhi Phifer will play Dauntless
leader Max. [Kate Winslet](/wiki/Kate_Winslet "Kate Winslet") was announced to
be in talks on January 24, 2013.[33] Later it was confirmed that she would
portray Jeanine Matthews.[34] Talking about playing the negative character for
the first time, Winslet said, "I'm no idiot. The idea went through my head
that I have never played a baddie before, I was almost kind of surprised."
Since Winslet joined the filming late, she used that distance from her co-
stars to appear aloof on the first day of her shoot. "I wanted to break it and
say, 'It's OK, I'm really fun. I promise.' But I thought, just for today, I'd
let them think that I am a complete bitch."[35] On March 25, 2013, [Ben
Lamb](/wiki/Ben_Lamb "Ben Lamb") was cast as Edward, [Ben Lloyd-
Hughes](/wiki/Ben_Lloyd-Hughes "Ben Lloyd-Hughes") as Will, and Christian
Madsen as Al.[36] In April 2013, [Ashley Judd](/wiki/Ashley_Judd "Ashley
Judd") and [Tony Goldwyn](/wiki/Tony_Goldwyn "Tony Goldwyn") joined the cast
as Natalie and Andrew Prior, Beatrice's parents.[37][38]

In 2014, the cast for the second film was announced. On May 12, 2014, it was
announced that [Octavia Spencer](/wiki/Octavia_Spencer "Octavia Spencer")
joined the cast as Amity representative [Johanna
Reyes](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Johanna_Reyes "List of
The Divergent trilogy characters").[39] Late May 2014, [Suki
Waterhouse](/wiki/Suki_Waterhouse "Suki Waterhouse") and [Jonny
Weston](/wiki/Jonny_Weston "Jonny Weston") were cast as
[Marlene](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Marlene "List of The
Divergent trilogy characters") and Edgar respectively.[40] Early June 2014,
[Stephanie Leigh Schlund](/wiki/Stephanie_Leigh_Schlund "Stephanie Leigh
Schlund") announced that she was cast in the film as a member of the
Amity,[41] and [Naomi Watts](/wiki/Naomi_Watts "Naomi Watts") and [Daniel Dae
Kim](/wiki/Daniel_Dae_Kim "Daniel Dae Kim") joined the cast as [Evelyn
Johnson](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Evelyn_Johnson-Eaton
"List of The Divergent trilogy characters") and [Jack
Kang](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Jack_Kang "List of The
Divergent trilogy characters").[42][43] On June 9, 2014, [Rosa
Salazar](/wiki/Rosa_Salazar "Rosa Salazar") joined the cast as
[Lynn](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Lynn "List of The
Divergent trilogy characters").[44] On June 10, 2014, Australian actor
[Keiynan Lonsdale](/wiki/Keiynan_Lonsdale "Keiynan Lonsdale") joined the cast
as [Uriah](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Uriah_Pedrad "List
of The Divergent trilogy characters").[45] On June 11, 2014, [Emjay
Anthony](/wiki/Emjay_Anthony "Emjay Anthony") joined the cast as
[Hector](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Other_characters "List
of The Divergent trilogy characters").[46]

On April 28, 2015, it was reported that [Golden Globe](/wiki/Golden_Globes
"Golden Globes") nominee [Jeff Daniels](/wiki/Jeff_Daniels "Jeff Daniels")
joined the cast for _Allegiant_ as
[David](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#David "List of The
Divergent trilogy characters"), the leader of the Bureau of Genetic
Welfare.[47] On May 1, 2015, it was announced that [Bill
Skarsgård](/wiki/Bill_Skarsg%C3%A5rd "Bill Skarsgård") had joined the cast as
[Matthew](/wiki/List_of_The_Divergent_trilogy_characters#Matthew "List of The
Divergent trilogy characters").[48]

###
Filming[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Filming")]

Principal photography of _Divergent_ began on April 16, 2013, and concluded on
July 16, 2013. Almost all of the filming took place in [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago
"Chicago") with reshoots taking place from January 24–26, 2014, in [Los
Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles").

Principal photography for _The Divergent Series: Insurgent_ began on May 27,
2014, in [Atlanta](/wiki/Atlanta "Atlanta"),
[Georgia](/wiki/Georgia_\(U.S._state\) "Georgia \(U.S. state\)")[49] and
concluded on September 6, 2014. Filming took place at [United States
Penitentiary, Atlanta](/wiki/United_States_Penitentiary,_Atlanta "United
States Penitentiary, Atlanta"). A set was constructed for the Amity Compound
at [Serenbe Community](/wiki/Serenbe "Serenbe") South of Atlanta. In downtown
Atlanta, a zip-line scene was filmed for which a set was constructed on the
roof of [Peachtree Center](/wiki/Peachtree_Center "Peachtree Center"). For two
days, production was moved to Chicago with scenes being filmed in [Wells
Street](/wiki/Wells_Street_\(Chicago\) "Wells Street \(Chicago\)"), [Franklin
Street](/wiki/Franklin_Street_Bridge "Franklin Street Bridge"), and Adams
Street. Production was then moved back to Atlanta for reshoots.

Principal photography for _The Divergent Series: Allegiant_ began in Atlanta
on May 18, 2015,[50][51] with filming concluding on August 23, 2015.

### Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Music")]

[Junkie XL](/wiki/Junkie_XL "Junkie XL") scored the first film in the film
series, _Divergent_ , while [Joseph Trapanese](/wiki/Joseph_Trapanese "Joseph
Trapanese") scored the second and third entries, _Insurgent_ and _Allegiant._

## Plot[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Plot")]

### _Divergent_
(2014)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Divergent \(2014\)")]

Main article: [Divergent (film)](/wiki/Divergent_\(film\) "Divergent
\(film\)")

In a world where people are divided into distinct factions based on human
virtues, Tris Prior is warned she is Divergent and will never fit into any one
group. When she discovers a conspiracy by a faction leader to destroy all
Divergents, Tris must learn to trust in the mysterious Four and together they
must find out what makes being Divergent so dangerous before it's too late.

### _The Divergent Series: Insurgent_
(2015)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: The Divergent Series: Insurgent \(2015\)")]

Main article: [The Divergent Series:
Insurgent](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Insurgent "The Divergent Series:
Insurgent")

As they search for allies and answers in the wake of the uprising, Tris and
Four are on the run. Hunted by Jeanine Matthews, leader of the Erudite
faction, Tris and Four race against time as they try to figure out what
Abnegation sacrificed their lives to protect, and why the Erudite leaders will
do anything to stop them. Haunted by her past choices but desperate to protect
the ones she loves, Tris faces one impossible challenge after another as she
unlocks the truth about the past and ultimately the future of her world.

### _The Divergent Series: Allegiant_
(2016)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: The Divergent Series: Allegiant \(2016\)")]

Main article: [The Divergent Series:
Allegiant](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Allegiant "The Divergent Series:
Allegiant")

On December 16, 2013, Summit Entertainment announced that the film adaptation
of _[Allegiant](/wiki/Allegiant_\(novel\) "Allegiant \(novel\)")_ would be
released on March 18, 2016.[12] On April 11, 2014, [Lionsgate](/wiki/Lionsgate
"Lionsgate") announced that the film adaptation would be split into two films
with the first part titled, _The Divergent Series: Allegiant – Part 1_.[52]
The film was then re-titled as _The Divergent Series: Allegiant_.[21]

Tris must escape with Four and go beyond the wall enclosing Chicago. For the
first time ever, they will leave the only city and family they have ever known
in order to find a peaceful solution for their embroiled city. Once outside,
old discoveries are quickly rendered meaningless with the revelation of
shocking new truths. Tris must quickly decide who she can trust as a ruthless
battle ignites beyond the walls of Chicago. In order to survive, Tris will be
forced to make impossible choices about courage, allegiance, sacrifice and
love.

### Cancelled
film[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Cancelled film")]

A Third sequel to the film was initially planned, with a March 2017 release,
based on the latter half of the _Allegiant_ book.[53] The timing was changed
to a June 2017 release, with [Lee Toland Krieger](/wiki/Lee_Toland_Krieger
"Lee Toland Krieger") then attached as the movie's director.[54][55]

### _Ascendant_ (TV
series)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: Ascendant \(TV series\)")]

In July 2016, after the poor performance of the third film at the box office,
the producers considered creating the fourth as a television film, which would
add new characters to the story who could continue in a spinoff television
series, moving beyond the books.[54][56]

In September 2016, [Shailene Woodley](/wiki/Shailene_Woodley "Shailene
Woodley") stated on _[Today](/wiki/Today_\(U.S._TV_program\) "Today \(U.S. TV
program\)")_ that the film versus television decision was not finalized, and
that it was "a limbo waiting game".[57] In the same interview Woodley spoke
despairingly of the chances of her returning to the project in a television
format, although noting she would be open to returning to it as a theatrical
film.[57] In February 2017, with the producers having confirmed that it would
be a television project, it was announced that Woodley had backed out of her
starring role.[58]

In August 2017, [Starz](/wiki/Starz "Starz") and [Lionsgate
Television](/wiki/Lionsgate_Television "Lionsgate Television") announced that
they were beginning to develop the TV series.[59]

##
Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Divergent_Series&action=edit&section=17
"Edit section: Reception")]

Further information on the reception of each film: [Divergent (film) §
Reception](/wiki/Divergent_\(film\)#Reception "Divergent \(film\)"), [The
Divergent Series: Insurgent §
Reception](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Insurgent#Reception "The Divergent
Series: Insurgent"), and [The Divergent Series: Allegiant §
Reception](/wiki/The_Divergent_Series:_Allegiant#Reception "The Divergent
Series: Allegiant")

Though the first two films were commercially successful, the series as a whole
has not been well received by critics. Each successive film release has been
rated lower than the previous release on [review
aggregator](/wiki/Review_aggregator "Review aggregator") websites. Negative
reviews of the third novel _Allegiant_ and the studios' decision to split it
into two films have been blamed for the third film's lackluster performance at
the box office.
